conclusion: Determine displacement from start of deceleration to restoration of normal speed.
Break down the problem into several steps.
Initial speed is 30 m/s, final speed is 5 m/s, acceleration is -1 m/s^2.
Use kinematic equation to find displacement during deceleration.
Calculate displacement during deceleration as 437.5 m.
Car travels 10 m at constant speed of 5 m/s.
Initial speed is 5 m/s, final speed is 30 m/s, acceleration is 1 m/s^2.
Use kinematic equation to find displacement during acceleration.
Calculate displacement during acceleration as 437.5 m.
Sum displacements from each phase to find total displacement.
